thread.title: Harrington rushes for 347 yards, Lamar beats ACU 44-28
thread.title_full: Harrington rushes for 347 yards, Lamar beats ACU 44-28

title: Harrington rushes for 347 yards, Lamar beats ACU 44-28
text:
Harrington rushes for 347 yards, Lamar beats ACU 44-28 By - Associated Press - Sunday, October 11, 2015 
BEAUMONT, Texas (AP) - Kade Harrington rushed for two touchdowns and a school and Southland Conference record of 347 yards to lead Lamar to a 44-28 win over Abilene Christian on Saturday night. 
Claude Mathis of Texas State held the old Southland Conference single-game mark of 310, set in 1996. 
Harrington, who broke for an 80-yard touchdown run in the second quarter, averaged 12.4 yards a carry. He also had a 62-yard run for a score in the fourth quarter. 
Harrington is now the career scoring leader at Lamar with 200 points, passing Sammy Carpenter, who had 198 points (1951-54). Harrington also moved to third in career rushing with 2,453 yards. 
Joe Minden threw for 130 yards and three touchdowns for Lamar (3-2, 2-1). 
Parker McKenzie led Abilene Christian (2-3, 2-2), throwing for 316 yards and three touchdowns.
